title: Email Signature Images not displaying
content:
Hi All,

Long time user of TB. Have worked with a number of signatures over the years. I occasionally have the below problem. This time it has become quite frustrating.

I have pictures in my email signature.

I have recently moved folders for all of my data. I get it. I need to update the path information for the HTML (built in MS Word) file. I have done that.

The signature is there... the images are not. The borders around the images are there, the images are not.

I do not know what is blocking the images from coming through.

I have the same issure on another computer that I use. Though I have never been abale to ge the pictures to load on that system. Borders only.

Image below with borders, no images

Any help would be much appreciated.

Thank you

Toll

title: Közös mappa
content:
Lehetséges-e az, hogy egy-egy emailfiókon belül közös legyen a bejövő, és a kimenő mappa?

Nem régen volt egy több nap alatt lezajlott 10-10 levélből álló üzenetváltásom valakivel, amit utólag át akartam olvasni. Ehhez a bejövő, és kimenő levelek időbélyege alapján bemásoltam a leveleket egy LibreOffice Writer dokumentumba. Nagyon nagy munka volt! Legalább 10 percig tartott.

Nem lehetne ezt valahogy megoldani? Az lenne jó, ha (válaszhatóan) egy mappában lennének a levelek, és rá lehetne szűrni a partner címére, és időrendbe lehetne szedni a leveleket. A bejövő és kimenő leveleket meg lehetne jelölni ikonokkal, ahogy a mobiltelefonoknál a híváslistában láthatók. Nem csevegésre gondolok! Mert azt mindkét félnek be kell állítania.

title: Signature by email address and message forward
content:
Dear Team,

There are two problems i found out in in newer version of thunderbird.

1) When we try to forward message, we never get space to write and it comes with different fonts and preformat, when we click it to Body text it comes with preformat automatically without our given command to Body text. Kindly fix it so we could use more comfortably.

2) When we get email sent by ourselves we click on edit as new see 2nd pick, when we click from 2nd account, signatures comes from new account, in previous version when we use CTRL Z, signature's were vanished, so we were more comfortable with that version, see pick 3 and now we delete manually which comes with extra space.

I previously commented on same but no response. Could you please able to solve this issue?

title: sending an attached file to a gmail user
content:
From File Explorer, you can send a file by right clicking and then choosing 'send to mail recipients'. This brings you to Thunderbird. If the mail recipient is using a gmail account, the message will not be sent.

This diagnostic is sent back:

These recipients of your message have been processed by the mail server: bdsweet111@gmail.com; Failed; 5.3.0 (other or undefined mail system status) 

   Remote MTA gmail-smtp-in.l.google.com: network error 


- SMTP protocol diagnostic: 550-5.7.26 This mail has been blocked because the sender is unauthenticated.
550-5.7.26 Gmail requires all senders to authenticate with either SPF or DKIM.
550-5.7.26 
550-5.7.26  Authentication results:
550-5.7.26  DKIM = did not pass
550-5.7.26  SPF [gmail.com] with ip: [65.20.63.175] = did not pass
550-5.7.26 
550-5.7.26  For instructions on setting up authentication, go to
550 5.7.26  https://support.google.com/mail/answer/81126#authentication d14-20020a05621421ce00b0069019d520f
creator: hrsweet3

title: How to create a custom email header in Thunderbird 115.4.1
content:
Google is implementing new requirements for mail sent to Gmail account holders. Among other things, bulk mailers have to include certain new header information in emails that reference that the sender has implemented one-click unsubscribe.

Because I send out a newsletter to 40,000 subscribers using a separate mailing program, I have customized the headers there easily. But since I also send personal and/or single emails from Thunderbird using the same domain, I want to add a custom header so any individual emails from Thunderbird will also have the new header info and not be automatically deleted by Google/Gmail.

How can I add a customized header to emails I send from Thunderbird 115.4.1 to comply with Google's new requirements?

The lines I have to add are like this:

List-Unsubscribe-Post: List-Unsubscribe=One-Click List-Unsubscribe: <mailto:<MYNAME@MYDOMAIN.COM?subject=Unsubscribe&body=remove <a href="/en-US/kb/new?title=-Email-" class="new" title="Page does not exist.">-Email-

Thanks, Edgar
creator: edgar17

title: Exporting/importing tasks

title: How to stop Thunderbird from attempting to download certificates from the directory
content:
Hi

We using Thunderbird with S/MIME in order to sign email and an LDAP directory access. When we do a reply all, Thunderbird try to download recipients certificates.

It's very long and useless for us ;) (it takes more than 1 minute to the popup to disappear, or we have to click on stop searching multiple times, one for recipient)

Is there anyway to deactivate this feature ? The only way is to disable LDAP, but we need LDAP.

Thanks ! Marc

Thunderbird 115.9.0
creator: marcolefo

title: Cannot locate Thunderbird profile folder on Windows 11
content: I'm trying to move Thunderbird to a new PC. Both PC's are running Windows 11. I've followed the instructions for locating my profile. According to "Troubleshooting Information" my profile is supposed to be located at "C:\Users\photo\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\k6i7koof.default-release\Mail\Local Folders". When I click on the "Open Folder" button, I receive an error message that the folder does not exist. When I try navigating to the folder manually, I can not find a "Thunderbird" folder under "AppData\Roaming". I've selected "Show Hidden Files/Folders" under Windows Explorer. I know my profile exists because I can access a set of Local Folders when I'm in Thunderbird. I'd really like to move those folders over to my new PC. Any help to find the profile folder will be much appreciated.

title: Is there anyway to get Command+E to search for the currently select text in macOS?
content:
In macOS, there's a convention where you can type Command+E to search for the currently selected text. That is, selecting some text and pressing Command+E is equivalent to pressing Command+F to open a find dialog or search field, and then typing whatever was selected into that field.

It works in Firefox, as well as numerous other apps. I've basically got this keystroke hardwired into my brain, so it's jarring when it doesn't work. Unfortunately in Thunderbird it's assigned to "Edit As New Message".

Is there any way I can change things so that this keystroke searches for the selected text, at least when viewing or editing a message?
creator: brian79
